alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 6:32PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Custer County through 715 PM CDT... At 632 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ansley, or 15 miles east of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ansley, Comstock, Westerville, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Wescott and Big Oak Canyon. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 87 and 103. Highway 2 between mile markers 293 and 296. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 301. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
